We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;HR &amp; Admin Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos

Job Summary


	HR &amp; Admin Manager will be responsible for organization&rsquo;s human resource management, people&nbsp;processes, and administrative operations.
	The role will ensure seamless HR delivery, compliance with&nbsp;statutory requirements, and efficient management of office administration to support business goals.

	Oversee local recruitment: sourcing, interviewing, and onboarding of the new hires

	Ensure compliance with all statutory labor and employment regulations
	Facilitate performance management, training coordination, and employee engagement initiatives
	Serve as a key liaison between Indian office and Nigeria HQ HR team
	Handle employee grievances, disciplinary processes, and exit formalities


Administrative Responsibilities:


	Set up and manage the coworking office operations and rental arrangements (infrastructure, supplies,&nbsp;services)
	Oversee vendor management (e.g. coworking space providers, IT support, suppliers)
	Handle office procurement and budget tracking
	Ensure smooth day-to-day functioning of the local office


Key Requirements


	A Bachelor&rsquo;s or Master&rsquo;s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration
	5+ years of relevant experience in HR and administrative roles in India preferably in a mid to large sized&nbsp;organization
	Certification in HR (e.g., SHRM, PHR, or equivalent) will be an added advantage
	Strong understanding of Indian labor laws and compliance frameworks
	Experience working with multinational or remote/global teams is a plus

HR & Admin Manager Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HR & Admin Manager

Job Location: Lagos

Job Summary
     

            
    




	HR & Admin Manager will be responsible for organization’s human resource management, people processes, and administrative operations.
	The role will ensure seamless HR delivery, compliance with statutory requirements, and efficient management of office administration to support business goals.


Key Duties and Responsibilities
HR Responsibilities:


	Oversee local recruitment: sourcing, interviewing, and onboarding of the new hires
	Manage employee records and ensure proper documentation
	Support the implementation of HR policies tailored to Indian labor laws and in alignment with group policies
	Ensure compliance with all statutory labor and employment regulations
	Facilitate performance management, training coordination, and employee engagement initiatives
	Serve as a key liaison between Indian office and Nigeria HQ HR team
	Handle employee grievances, disciplinary processes, and exit formalities


Administrative Responsibilities:


	Set up and manage the coworking office operations and rental arrangements (infrastructure, supplies, services)
	Oversee vendor management (e.g. coworking space providers, IT support, suppliers)
	Handle office procurement and budget tracking
	Ensure smooth day-to-day functioning of the local office


Key Requirements


	A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration
	5+ years of relevant experience in HR and administrative roles in India preferably in a mid to large sized organization
	Certification in HR (e.g., SHRM, PHR, or equivalent) will be an added advantage
	Strong understanding of Indian labor laws and compliance frameworks
	Experience working with multinational or remote/global teams is a plus

Senior HRBP Manager Job at PZ Cussons




        
    

        
        PZ Cussons is a dynamic consumer products group and innovator of some of the world's best known and loved brands. Calling on over 130 years of expertise, we operate internationally in carefully selected developed and emerging markets that present the greatest strategic potential for future growth. Our world-class supply chain and distribution networks enable us to meet our global consumer needs and deliver quality brands that add value and enhance everyday lives.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Senior HRBP Manager

Job Requisition ID: JR001828
Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time (On-site)

Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Collaborate with factory leadership to enable our talents achieve business objectives and align HR strategies that contribute to operational success.
	Contribute to the creation and execution of HR programs and initiatives that address business needs and improve employee satisfaction.
	Collaborate with leadership to identify key talent needs and develop strategies for retaining and developing potential employees.
	Implement performance management processes, including goal setting, performance evaluations, and career development plans.
	Manage engagement program in order to enhance factory's performance and promote a positive employee experience


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in industrial engineering, Management, Business Administration, or a related field.
	A minimum of 7 years of progressive HR experience, with at least 2 years in a senior HRBP role.
	Strong understanding of labor laws, regulations, and HR best practices in a manufacturing FMCG environment.
	Proven ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and influence decision-making at various organizational levels.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and resolve conflicts effectively.
	Experience in change management, organizational development, and employee engagement initiatives.
	Proficiency in HRIS systems and MS Office suite; experience with workforce analytics is a plus.
	Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle sensitive and confidential information with discretion.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Chief Inventory Officer, Stores",
  "description": "Dangote Industries Limited is a diversified conglomerate with interests in various sectors including cement, sugar, salt, flour, and more. We are committed to driving growth and development in Africa through our investments and innovative solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Inventory Officer, Stores

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibese Plant, Ogun
Job Type: Full-time&nbsp;

Key Duties &amp; Responsibilities


	Take charge of managing the Material Management (MM) modules within the SAP system, ensuring their optimal functioning and alignment with organizational goals.
	Generate a comprehensive range of reports using SAP to facilitate data-driven decision-making across various departments.
	Transform complex generated reports into easily digestible formats to enhance understanding and usability for stakeholders at all levels.
	Supervise the processes involved in materials replenishment and planning, ensuring that supplies are adequately maintained to meet operational demands.
	Oversee the codification of materials, ensuring a systematic approach to inventory management and tracking.
	Manage the categorization and counting of inventory to maintain accurate records and streamline inventory control processes.
	Provide support for the implementation of effective inventory management practices, contributing to increased efficiency and reduced costs.
	Undertake any additional duties as assigned by management, demonstrating flexibility and a commitment to supporting team objectives.


Academic / Professional Qualifications


	Bachelor&#39;s degree (BSc) or Higher National Diploma (HND) in supply chain management or any related numerate discipline + 12 years relevant experience.
	Membership in professional bodies related to materials management, procurement &amp; supply chain, and warehouse management, highlighting a commitment to professional development and adherence to industry standards.
	Relevant certifications such as SAP accreditation or equivalent training in ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems, demonstrating technical proficiency and the ability to leverage technology for efficient operations.


Skills &amp; Competencies


	Comprehensive knowledge of the cement industry, including current trends, potential challenges, and the competitive landscape, enabling informed decision-making and strategic planning.
	Proficient understanding of inventory planning, control, and management practices, essential for maintaining optimal stock levels and minimizing costs.
	Advanced skills in Microsoft Office applications, ensuring proficiency in tools that enhance productivity and facilitate data analysis.
	Exceptional problem-solving abilities, allowing for the identification of issues and the development of effective solutions in a timely manner.

Chief Inventory Officer, Stores Job at Dangote Industries Limited




        
    

        
        Dangote Industries Limited is a diversified conglomerate with interests in various sectors including cement, sugar, salt, flour, and more. We are committed to driving growth and development in Africa through our investments and innovative solutions.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Chief Inventory Officer, Stores

Job Location: Ibese Plant, Ogun
Job Type: Full-time 

Key Duties & Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Take charge of managing the Material Management (MM) modules within the SAP system, ensuring their optimal functioning and alignment with organizational goals.
	Generate a comprehensive range of reports using SAP to facilitate data-driven decision-making across various departments.
	Transform complex generated reports into easily digestible formats to enhance understanding and usability for stakeholders at all levels.
	Supervise the processes involved in materials replenishment and planning, ensuring that supplies are adequately maintained to meet operational demands.
	Oversee the codification of materials, ensuring a systematic approach to inventory management and tracking.
	Manage the categorization and counting of inventory to maintain accurate records and streamline inventory control processes.
	Provide support for the implementation of effective inventory management practices, contributing to increased efficiency and reduced costs.
	Undertake any additional duties as assigned by management, demonstrating flexibility and a commitment to supporting team objectives.


Academic / Professional Qualifications


	Bachelor's degree (BSc) or Higher National Diploma (HND) in supply chain management or any related numerate discipline + 12 years relevant experience.
	Membership in professional bodies related to materials management, procurement & supply chain, and warehouse management, highlighting a commitment to professional development and adherence to industry standards.
	Relevant certifications such as SAP accreditation or equivalent training in ERP (Enterprise Resource Planning) systems, demonstrating technical proficiency and the ability to leverage technology for efficient operations.


Skills & Competencies


	Comprehensive knowledge of the cement industry, including current trends, potential challenges, and the competitive landscape, enabling informed decision-making and strategic planning.
	Proficient understanding of inventory planning, control, and management practices, essential for maintaining optimal stock levels and minimizing costs.
	Advanced skills in Microsoft Office applications, ensuring proficiency in tools that enhance productivity and facilitate data analysis.
	Exceptional problem-solving abilities, allowing for the identification of issues and the development of effective solutions in a timely manner.
	Strong organizational and project management competencies, necessary for prioritizing tasks and managing multiple projects concurrently.
	Demonstrated initiative and a proactive approach to tasks, essential for driving continuous improvement and innovation within the organization.
	Working knowledge of ERP systems, specifically SAP and other relevant applications, crucial for streamlined business processes and data management.
	Skillful report generation capabilities, facilitating informed decision-making through clear and concise data analysis.
	High level of integrity and ethical standards, promoting a trustworthy and accountable work environment.
	Understanding of health and safety regulations as they pertain to inventory management, ensuring compliance and the wellbeing of all team members.
	Proven ability to work collaboratively in team settings, with effective communication skills to foster a cooperative work atmosphere and enhance team performance.


Benefits


	Private Health Insurance
	Paid Time Off
	Training & Development.

  "title": "Marketing Manager",
  "description": "SecureHub.ng is a pioneering mobile-first platform built to transform Nigeria&rsquo;s gig economy by bridging the gap between employers and a dynamic, underutilized workforce of students. Targeting key urban centers &ndash; Lagos, Abuja, and Port Harcourt &ndash; SecureHub.ng connects businesses with qualified student talent for a broad range of short-term assignments, including Hospitality, Industrial and Warehousing , Facilities, Business Support, Retail.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Permanent - Full-Time

Job Description


	Ready to help build Nigeria&rsquo;s #1 platform for flexible work?&nbsp;SecureHub Connect is on the hunt for a creative, results-driven, and passionate Marketing Manager to help supercharge our growth.
	Based in Ibadan with a full-time work arrangement, this permanent role is perfect for someone who wants to make a real impact, drive user adoption, and shape the future of work for thousands of Nigerians.
	As our Marketing Manager, you&rsquo;ll bring our brand to life through campaigns that attract both employers needing reliable staff and workers looking for income opportunities.
	Ready to transform how Nigeria works? Let&rsquo;s talk.


Responsibilities


	Design and execute bold, multi-channel marketing strategies that grow both sides of our marketplace.
	Build eye-catching social media campaigns that turn heads and drive action.
	Craft messaging that speaks directly to students, job seekers, and businesses.
	Launch on-campus activations, influencer partnerships, and local events to keep SHUB Connect top of mind.
	Oversee lead generation and conversion funnels to drive sign-ups and app downloads.
	Analyze data like a pro, learn what works, and make it even better.
	Engage extensively with Sales and Operations teams to ensure one clear, unified message.
	Create marketing materials that sell our vision: presentations, flyers, social ads, and more.
	Manage and grow our vibrant social media communities.
	Secure partnership opportunities with universities, businesses, and youth communities.
	Stay plugged in to the latest gig economy and marketing trends, always be innovating.
	Support employer outreach campaigns to build trust and drive demand.
	Plan and execute local events or webinars to strengthen community engagement.


Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:


	Bachelor&#39;s Degree or Higher qualification in Marketing or relevant field
	5+ years in marketing, digital marketing, growth marketing, or brand management.
	Excellent communicator with strong writing and verbal skills in English Language.
	Proven ability to run effective social media campaigns.
	Comfortable using data to make smart marketing decisions.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience marketing to youth, students, entry-level job seekers.
	Background in recruitment, HR tech, or gig work platforms.
	Familiarity with marketing automation tools and CRMs.
	Ability to juggle multiple campaigns without dropping the ball.
	Self-starter who thrives in a dynamic environment.

	Digital Advertising (Facebook/Google Ads)

	Social Media Management
	Data-Driven Decision Making
	Community Building
	Relationship Management
	Campaign Planning &amp; Execution
	The ideal candidate must have prior experience in the Marketing field with an evidence track record, must live in Ibadan or willing to relocate and can report to the head office at least Monday - Friday.


Why Join SecureHub Connect?


	We&rsquo;re not just another platform, we&rsquo;re on a mission to unlock meaningful earning opportunities for Nigeria&rsquo;s youth and informal workforce.


You&rsquo;ll join a team that is:


	Bold and innovative
	Driven by impact
	Focused on real growth for real people


Benefits


	We have a great culture at Shub Connect, working closely together as one team. Our founders wanted to create a company that was disruptive, innovative, and forward thinking and they&rsquo;ve created a positive, welcoming environment for people to work and thrive within.


Your benefits include:


	21 days of annual leave (plus public holidays)
	Free tea and coffee
	Modern office
	Social events
	Ongoing training and development opportunities
	24 hours electricity
	After probationary period.


Note:&nbsp;Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and should you qualify for the role, a member of our team would reach out to you to advise the next step.",

Marketing Manager Job at SecureHub Connect




        
    

        
        SecureHub.ng is a pioneering mobile-first platform built to transform Nigeria’s gig economy by bridging the gap between employers and a dynamic, underutilized workforce of students. Targeting key urban centers – Lagos, Abuja, and Port Harcourt – SecureHub.ng connects businesses with qualified student talent for a broad range of short-term assignments, including Hospitality, Industrial and Warehousing , Facilities, Business Support, Retail.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Permanent - Full-Time

Job Description
     

            
    




	Ready to help build Nigeria’s #1 platform for flexible work? SecureHub Connect is on the hunt for a creative, results-driven, and passionate Marketing Manager to help supercharge our growth.
	Based in Ibadan with a full-time work arrangement, this permanent role is perfect for someone who wants to make a real impact, drive user adoption, and shape the future of work for thousands of Nigerians.
	As our Marketing Manager, you’ll bring our brand to life through campaigns that attract both employers needing reliable staff and workers looking for income opportunities.
	Ready to transform how Nigeria works? Let’s talk.


Responsibilities


	Design and execute bold, multi-channel marketing strategies that grow both sides of our marketplace.
	Build eye-catching social media campaigns that turn heads and drive action.
	Craft messaging that speaks directly to students, job seekers, and businesses.
	Launch on-campus activations, influencer partnerships, and local events to keep SHUB Connect top of mind.
	Oversee lead generation and conversion funnels to drive sign-ups and app downloads.
	Analyze data like a pro, learn what works, and make it even better.
	Engage extensively with Sales and Operations teams to ensure one clear, unified message.
	Create marketing materials that sell our vision: presentations, flyers, social ads, and more.
	Manage and grow our vibrant social media communities.
	Secure partnership opportunities with universities, businesses, and youth communities.
	Stay plugged in to the latest gig economy and marketing trends, always be innovating.
	Support employer outreach campaigns to build trust and drive demand.
	Plan and execute local events or webinars to strengthen community engagement.


Qualifications
Basic Qualifications:


	Bachelor's Degree or Higher qualification in Marketing or relevant field
	5+ years in marketing, digital marketing, growth marketing, or brand management.
	Excellent communicator with strong writing and verbal skills in English Language.
	Proven ability to run effective social media campaigns.
	Comfortable using data to make smart marketing decisions.


Preferred Qualifications:


	Experience marketing to youth, students, entry-level job seekers.
	Background in recruitment, HR tech, or gig work platforms.
	Familiarity with marketing automation tools and CRMs.
	Ability to juggle multiple campaigns without dropping the ball.
	Self-starter who thrives in a dynamic environment.
	A track record of hitting growth goals or lead targets.
	Deep understanding of Nigeria’s employment landscape and local culture.
	Ability to work under minimum or zero supervision


Suggested Skills:


	Digital Advertising (Facebook/Google Ads)
	Content Creation & Copywriting
	Graphic Designing
	Social Media Management
	Data-Driven Decision Making
	Community Building
	Relationship Management
	Campaign Planning & Execution
	The ideal candidate must have prior experience in the Marketing field with an evidence track record, must live in Ibadan or willing to relocate and can report to the head office at least Monday - Friday.


Why Join SecureHub Connect?


	We’re not just another platform, we’re on a mission to unlock meaningful earning opportunities for Nigeria’s youth and informal workforce.


You’ll join a team that is:


	Bold and innovative
	Driven by impact
	Focused on real growth for real people


Benefits


	We have a great culture at Shub Connect, working closely together as one team. Our founders wanted to create a company that was disruptive, innovative, and forward thinking and they’ve created a positive, welcoming environment for people to work and thrive within.


Your benefits include:


	21 days of annual leave (plus public holidays)
	Free tea and coffee
	Modern office
	Social events
	Ongoing training and development opportunities
	24 hours electricity
	After probationary period.


Note: Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis and should you qualify for the role, a member of our team would reach out to you to advise the next step.
